title: Untitled (Red), Mexico City, 2024
description:
Fine art photographer Adrian Gaut’s limited-edition photographs transform the intricate details of Mexico City’s buildings into bold, abstract compositions. Shot through the shadows, “Untitled (Red), Mexico City, 2024” features a rich, red concrete facade and strong geometric detail. The image is printed on textured fine art paper. The flush mount features a 3" white border and arrives ready to hang in a white painted maple wood frame. Limited edition of 25 of each style.
  • Part of photographer Adrian Gaut’s “Untitled” series.
  • Limited edition of 25 of each style.
  • Printed on textured fine art paper.
  • Arrives framed and ready to hang.
Brand
Adrian Gaut
General Dimensions
  • 40" H 30" W 2½" D
Product Weight
20 lbs
Assembly
Comes fully assembled
Warranty
2-year warranty

title: Untitled (Red & White), Mexico City, 2024
description:
Fine art photographer Adrian Gaut’s limited-edition photographs transform the intricate details of Mexico City’s buildings into bold, abstract compositions. The contrasting architectural elements in “Untitled (Red & White), Mexico City, 2024” give the effect of a painted canvas. Under Gaut’s lens, the medley of fine lines and block color reveal an unexpected beauty. The image is printed on textured fine art paper. The flush mount features a 3" white border and arrives ready to hang in a white painted maple wood frame. Limited edition of 25 of each style.
  • Part of photographer Adrian Gaut’s “Untitled” series.
  • Limited edition of 25 of each style.
  • Printed on textured fine art paper.
  • Arrives framed and ready to hang.

title: Untitled (Blue), Mexico City, 2024
description:
Fine art photographer Adrian Gaut’s limited-edition photographs transform the intricate details of Mexico City’s buildings into bold, abstract compositions. “Untitled (Blue), Mexico City, 2024” has an otherworldly feeling. The building’s mottled blue facade is framed against a similarly hued sky, which almost distorts space and time. The image is printed on textured fine art paper. The flush mount features a 3" white border and arrives ready to hang in a white painted maple wood frame. Limited edition of 25 of each style.

title: Untitled (UNAM I), Mexico City, 2024
description:
Fine art photographer Adrian Gaut’s limited-edition photographs transform the intricate details of Mexico City’s buildings into bold, abstract compositions. In “Untitled (UNAM I), Mexico City, 2024” distinct architectural elements create a pleasing unity. The clash of vertical rust-red linework, smooth off-white panels, and gridded beige details reveals an abstract beauty. The image is printed on textured fine art paper. The flush mount features a 3" white border and arrives ready to hang in a white painted maple wood frame. Limited edition of 25 of each style.
  • Part of photographer Adrian Gaut’s “Untitled” series.
  • Limited edition of 25 of each style.
  • Printed on textured fine art paper.
  • Arrives framed and ready to hang.

title: Ballylagan Collection
description:
In this exclusive series for DWR, sculptor Mary Little meticulously tailors and stretches cotton canvas to create subtle abstract reliefs. As she draws, cuts, and sews, Little infuses the canvas with story. Each undulating surface evokes the emotion of a landscape, the Irish countryside of her childhood, and is named for the people, towns, and natural beauty of her homeland. Now based in Los Angeles, Little’s ritualistic process of creation remains highly bespoke and deeply personal. Stanley's Lane and Sandy's Hollow are a limited edition of 50; Bailey's Acre, Hugh's Hill, Harrison's Hill, and Findley's Field are a limited edition of 30. Arrives mounted and ready to hang. Made in U.S.A.
  • DWR-exclusive original artwork by sculptor Mary Little.
  • Six bespoke pieces feature hand-tailored stretched-cotton canvas.
  • Arrives mounted and ready to hang.
Brand
Mary Little
General Dimensions
  • 36" H 36" W 3" D
Product Weight
8 lbs
Assembly
Comes fully assembled
Warranty
DWR honors a one (1) year warranty on all products. Brand-specific warranties may extend to longer periods.

title: Armin Hofmann Poster
description:
Herman Miller has a long tradition of styling its physical spaces with bold ads and graphics, a process it calls “environmental enrichment.” Fans of the brand often ask where they can find these works of art, which prompted the company to reprint select pieces from its archives. One of the most frequent requests is for this poster by Armin Hofmann. The Swiss designer is recognized for his role in developing the International Typographic Style, a graphic design movement characterized by clarity and simplicity of form. In 1962, Herman Miller commissioned him to create this poster for the brand’s European showrooms.
  • Limited-edition high-resolution digital print on 100% cotton paper.
  • Archival artwork reproduced from the Herman Miller archives.
  • Appears to float in its frame, creating a graphic look when on the wall.
  • American maple frame with a white, black, or natural finish.
  • Made by hand in Austin, Texas.
Brand
Herman Miller
Collection
Herman Miller Archival Poster Collection
General Dimensions
  • 53½" H 38½" W 2½" D
Product Weight
20 lbs
Assembly
Requires Assembly
Warranty
1-year warranty

title: Hot Dog Picnic Poster
description:
Starting in 1970, in-house graphic designer Steve Frykholm designed bold, graphic posters for Herman Miller’s annual employee picnic. These distinctive posters became coveted collectibles, even included in the permanent collection of the Museum of Modern Art. Herman Miller has now reissued the Hot Dog Picnic Poster from their archives. A series favorite, the Hot Dog Poster is an abstract take on classic Americana, printed on 100% cotton paper and encased in a floating frame that focuses attention on the art. Made in U.S.A.
  • Authentic limited-run reprint from the Herman Miller archives.
  • Printed on 100% cotton paper.
  • Appears to float in its frame, creating a graphic look when hung on the wall.
Brand
Herman Miller
Collection
